::: {.cell}

:::


::: {.cell}

:::

This page provides information about the valid indicative distribution map for the ecosystem functional group [**M1.2 Kelp forests**](/efg-info/M1_2.qmd). For older or alternative maps, see [here](/map-info/M1_2_history.qmd).

## Methods

Here is the methods summary for **Map code and version**: M1.2.web.orig v2.2.

> Ecoregions with major and minor occurrences of Kelp forests were identified by overlaying a global map of kelp systems (Wernberg and Filbee-Dexter 2019) on marine ecoregions (Spalding et al. 2008), and then clipping to bathymetry with <80m depth (Becker et al. 2009). Clipped ecoregions were assigned to major and minor occurrences based on information in Wernberg and Filbee-Dexter (2019) and author expertise, and proofed by specialist reviewers. Occurrences were converted to 30 arc second spatial resolution.

::: {.cell}

:::



::: {.cell}

:::



### Datasets

**Kelpforest-list** (Wernberg and Filbee-Dexler 2019):

Source of _distribution range_.
 Resolution: variable (points), static.
 Accuracy evaluation: known records.

 **MEOW-2008** (Spalding MD et al.  2008):

Source of _biogeographical range_.
 Resolution: variable (polygons), static.
 Accuracy evaluation: qualitative (experts judgement).

::: {.cell}
::: {.cell-output-display}


|dataset   |url                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     |
|:---------|:---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
|MEOW-2008 |<https://www.worldwildlife.org/publications/marine-ecoregions-of-the-world-a-bioregionalization-of-coastal-and-shelf-areas>{target='links'} :: <https://databasin.org/datasets/3b6b12e7bcca419990c9081c0af254a2>{target='links'} :: <http://maps.tnc.org/gis_data.html>{target='links'} |


:::
:::

### Processing

Processing steps used in this map are: *NA*.

### Map evaluation


This map is considered to be a ***Medium quality map*** based on the following characteristics:

Concept alignment is *Direct,general*.

Ground observations are _yes_.

 The accuracy evaluation *Known records,documented,qualitative*.

## How to use the data

### Available files

:::{.aside}

Following maps are considered current and valid indicative distribution maps for this ecosystem functional group. `Web navigation` maps are optimised for use in webapps, but they have similar methods and differ only in details of format and processing. 

- Web navigation (**code: M1.2.web.orig**, version v2.2) 
 - Indicative Map (**code: M1.2.IM.orig**, version v2.1) 


:::

You can download geospatial data for this map from the following sources:

**M1.2.web.orig** (v2.2): [Google Cloud bucket](gs://iucn_get_l3_im/M1.2.web.orig_v2.2.tif){target="gisdata"} :: [Zenodo repository (bundle of maps)](http://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.5090419){target="gisdata"} :: [Zenodo repository (EFG map)](https://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.5090927){target="gisdata"} :: [Mapbox tileset](https://studio.mapbox.com/tilesets/jrfep.M1_2_web_orig){target="gisdata"} :: [Earth Engine assets](projects/earthengine-legacy/assets/users/jrferrerparis/IUCN-GET/L3_IndMaps/){target="gisdata"}

**M1.2.IM.orig** (v2.1): [Google Cloud bucket](gs://iucn_get_l3_im/M1.2.IM.orig_v2.1.tif){target="gisdata"} :: [Zenodo repository (bundle of maps)](http://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.3958934){target="gisdata"}

Note that you need to login to some services like [mapbox](https://www.mapbox.com){target="links"} or [earthengine](https://earthengine.google.com){target="links"}, and in some cases you also need to request access to the files.

###  License information

Indicative maps have been released with a ![](https://zenodo.org/static/icons/licenses/cc-by-icon.svg){height=20} Creative Commons Attribution 4.0 International license. 

Datasets used to create this map might have some restriction for commercial use, see details below.


::: {.cell}
::: {.cell-output-display}

:::
:::

## References

References used in this version of the maps.

- Wernberg T, Filbee-Dexter K (2019) *Missing the marine forest for the trees* **Mar Ecol Prog Ser** 612:209-215 [DOI:10.3354/meps12867](http:dx.doi.org/10.3354/meps12867) 
 - Spalding MD, Fox HE, Allen GR, Davidson N, Ferdaña ZA, Finlayson M, Halpern BS, Jorge MA, Lombana A, Lourie SA, Martin KD, McManus E, Molnar J, Recchia CA, Robertson J (2007) *Marine ecoregions of the world: a bioregionalization of coastal and shelf areas*. **Bioscience** 57: 573–583. DOI:[10.1641/B570707](https://doi.org/10.1641/B570707)
  
 - Becker JJ, Sandwell DT, Smith WHF, Braud J, Binder B, Depner J, Fabre D, Factor J, Ingalls S, Kim S-H, Ladner R, Marks K, Nelson S, Pharaoh A, Trimmer R, Von Rosenberg J, Wallace G, Weatherall P (2009) *Global Bathymetry and Elevation Data at 30 Arc Seconds Resolution: SRTM30_PLUS*, **Marine Geodesy** 32: 355-371.
